It should work.  One thing I forgot to mention in the read me.  Don't install the 2.2.0 patch if you want to play on a free server because it won't work.  

To avoid the 2.2.0 patch from trying to auto install when you launch wow, be sure to launch using WoW.exe, NOT launcher.exe

yes, the patches did download just fine.. 

anyone have a key?

Well...you can buy the CD keys online, but you might want to be careful with that.  Some of those places will sell you used keys, and you'll be screwed.

Your best bet if you want to play on the official servers, is just to buy the game.  You'll be paying the $15/mo to play the game anyway, so might as well buy the software as well...

If you want to play for free, you should really check out the free servers, they're a lot of fun.  And if you don't like them, you can always go with option one. ;)

Ok...I screwed up and missed two patches.  I'm sorry for that.

I made a new torrent with just the patches for you guys.
http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3827467/World_of_Warcraft_Patches_from_2.0.0_to_2.1.3

The missing ones are 

01 - WoW-2.1.0.6692-enUS-patch.exe
04 -WoW-2.1.1.6739-to-2.1.2.6803-enUS-patch.exe

So those are the only two you need to download if you've already downloaded this torrent.

You have to run from WoW.exe.  Even if you uncheck the "Show Launcher" option on the login screen, it's still launching the program from Launcher.exe which is what tells it to pull updates.

You need to go to your shortcut properties and change the target from "C:\Program Files\World of Warcraft\Launcher.exe" to "C:\Program Files\World of Warcraft\WoW.exe"

Then it will not auto update.
